snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has asked a task force that includes police and correction commissioners to provide him with ideas on how to reduce the rate of incarceration.
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio has asked his commissioners and aides to provide him with a plan by September 2014 to reduce the rate of incarceration among New Yorkers with mental illness; effort, called the Task Force on Behavioral Health and the Criminal Justice System, is administration’s first major criminal justice initiative and will include recommendations from variety of law enforcement officials.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio has asked a task force that includes police and correction commissioners to provide him with ideas on how to reduce the rate of incarceration.

headline.main: Panel to Create Plan to Reduce Number of Mentally Ill People in New York City Jails
headline.print_headline: Panel to Create Plan to Reduce Number of Mentally Ill People in City Jails
